Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Patellofemoral Arthroplasty and Total Knee Arthroplasty for Isolated Patellofemoral Osteoarthritis

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included debilitating symptoms and isolated PF-OA

Objective.evidence: aimed to compare the long-term outcomes of patellofemoral arthroplasty (PFA) versus total knee arthroplasty (TKA)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the SF-36 bodily pain score over six years

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was maintained for the first year

Number_Randomised.evidence: 100 patients, randomised 1:1 to PFA or TKA between 2007 and 2014

Result_Outcome.evidence: PFA showed greater improvement in SF-36 bodily pain (mean difference 12, 95% CI 4 to 20; p = 0.004)
